text: fifty-one percent of net users live outside the us (international data corporation)  ... half the world's population has never placed a phone call (deloitte research) ... some 70 million americans will carry pagers by 2000, up from 42 million in 1996 (technology futures) ... more than 1 million americans bought digital cameras in 1998, nearly three times the 1996 number (photo marketing association international) ... one in five us households has a home theater system, up from one in 25 in 1994 (consumer electronics manufacturers association) ... an online transaction costs a bank one-tenth of a cent to process, versus a dollar for face-to-face (booz-allen & hamilton) ... online credit card transactions generate 47 percent of visa's customer complaints in europe, while just 1 to 2 percent of the company's business there comes from online purchases (visa international) ... half of all mainstream companies in the us will sell products online by 2001 (financial executives institute; duke university) ... of the 93 percent of americans aware of the y2k problem, just 66 percent think it will be completely solved before 2000 (fox news; opinion dynamics) ... us publishers of video and pc games lost $3.2 billion worldwide to piracy last year (interactive digital software association) ... video and pc game sales jumped 29 percent last year (interactive digital software association) ... as of march, there were 1,426 hate sites on the web, more than double the figure at the end of '97 (simon weisenthal center) ... as of january, half of us adult net users were female (media metrix)must readsputterniktired/wiredgood dealas the well turnsall's well that ends wellsmarter bombbattlefield of tomorrowpass it onfashion policewhy buy retail?paranoia technologytailor-made medspeoplejargon watchpersonality typingcustomize or diesailing the red skiesgrubstake grillt1, good buddyraw data
